general_info: Sulbactam-durlobactam is a co-packaged product approved for the treatment of hospital-acquired bacterial pneumonia and ventilator-associated bacterial pneumonia (HABP/VABP) caused by susceptible isolates of Acinetobacter baumannii-calcoaceticus complex in patients ≥18 years of age.

Sulbactam is a penicillanic acid sulfone. Besides functioning as an Ambler Class A beta-lactamase inhibitor, it has intrinsic antibacterial activity against Acinetobacter baumannii-calcoaceticus complex (via inhibition of PBP1a, PBP1b, and PBP3). Note that beta-lactamases of all four Ambler classes are able to degrade sulbactam (Front Microbiol 2021;12:709974).

Durlobactam is a diazabicyclooctane beta-lactamase inhibitor with broad-spectrum activity against Class A, C, and D enzymes, including Class D OXA carbapenemases that are prevalent in Acinetobacter baumannii. Durlobactam alone has no antibacterial activity against Acinetobacter baumannii-calcoaceticus complex isolates.
Expert Rev Anti Infect Ther 2025;23:67; Pharmacotherapy 2023;43:502.
adult_dose: (1 gm of sulbactam and 1 gm of durlobactam) IV (over 3 hr) q6h.
Compatible with NS. Compatibility with other solutions not established.
Recommended duration of treatment 7-14 days, guided by patient clinical status.

pediatric_dose.guidance: AMR gram-negative guidance: J Pediatric Infect Dis Soc 2025;14:piaf004
pediatric_dose.fda: Per FDA: Safety and efficacy not established
pediatric_dose.amr_guidance: Per AMR gram-negative guidance: Infants/children: 200 mg/kg/day (of sulbactam), divided q4-6h Adolescents: use adult dosing

crcl_or_egfr: CrCl <15: (Sul 1 gm + Durlo 1 gm) q12h x3 doses, then q24h
renal_adjustment.hemodialysis: Use CrCl <15 dosing (dose AD on dialysis days)

pregnancy_risk.fda_risk_category: Sulbactam: no evidence of toxicity in humans or animals. Durlobactam: no human data, evidence of skeletal variations in mice.
pregnancy_risk.use_during_lactation: No data regarding effects on the breastfed infant or milk production. Sulbactam is present in milk in low concentrations; no data for durlobactam.

pharmacology.peak_serum_conc_mcg_ml: Sulbactam: 32.4 (1 gm q6h, SS), Durlobactam: 29.2 (1 gm q6h, SS)
pharmacology.auc_mcg_hr_ml: Sulbactam: 515 (1 gm q6h, 0-24h), Durlobactam: 471 (1 gm q6h, 0-24h)
